text: My new discovery and new place for boba tea.  I tried their mango fluffy snow with mocha, bananas and condensed milk ~ it was yummy! But I will go with red and mango toppings next time.

This is one of the best places for boba tea in the city.  They have an extensive menu featuring the usual flavored black and green teas, slushes, snow ices, and smoothies.  Their prices are more reasonable than most tea houses in Chinatown, the service is friendly, and the place is clean as can be.  There are always people getting take-out drinks here and there are a couple tables inside and out front.  Favs include the strawberry milk tea and passion fruit black tea, both with boba.  My husband loves their fruit slushes.
I sure miss this Boba experience! Every trip to Vegas finds me here. Their large is perfect! The Boba is perfect. Their honey milk tea is just the right sweetness!

There's nothing more refreshing than boba on a hot Vegas afternoon. The lichi and watermelon slushys were right on point. The mango however, a little too sweet. Check in before ordering for the size upgrade!

One of my favorite places to get Boba... 

The location is great because it's in the southwest part of town, open one in the northwest of town and I'll be even more happy! 

There is a wide variety of different smoothies and teas. You can topping like Boba, lychee, aloe, and more. My favorite is the watermelon slush and green tea slush. Green tea slush with boba and aloe oh man it's so over! They also serve finger foods which are really good but if you order spicy keep in mind they really mean spicy. Lobster balls are my favorite, it is am must try if you never tried it before!
We love honey lemon green iced tea with boba, green tea smoothies and milk tea.  It's a shame there's only one location!

I recently introduced a friend of mine to Boba which started our little Boba adventure. That's right I literally went to 5 Boba places within a week ordering the same Boba milk tea. I'm seriously boba'd out. Easy Life Boba has the Best Boba in town! Yes better than the ones in Chinatown! Plus it's cheaper "cha ching" and less crowded for someone who's looking for a quick stop.
Love this place! No other places in LV cooked Boba right. Moving from So Cal it was hard to believe how hard it was to find a boba place that does it.

Located on Desert Inn and Durango, Easy Life makes it even more convenient for me to get boba without venturing into Chinatown. No need to endure the driving of those on Spring Mountain!

The milk teas and flavored teas are balanced just right and are oh-so-refreshing! Their boba has the right chewy and soft texture and a bit of sweetness to them. Slightly different than your traditional shaved ice, their fluffy snow has its flavoring frozen in the ice, shaved into a mound of soft, edible snow, and then you get to choose toppings like fresh fruit and jellies. Never had their slushies or snacks, but I might give it a try another time.

Glad this place is closer to home, but not too close or else I'd be here too often!
They have great milk teas.  I tend to order the avocado smoothie with boba, which is wayy better than it sounds.  Also, the popcorn chicken is one of my favorites snacks.
Love their milk teas, tarro and Thai tea was on spot and the boba was very fresh! Yelp has a coupon for this place too. They also have extra large sizes if you are into that, they last me two days!

When I'm in the mood for boba tea, this is my go-to place in town. It's got a great selection of drinks along with nice quality and serving sizes at reasonable prices. My only (minor) gripe is their decision to discontinue their frequent customer card program.

ok alot of people mentioned their  popcorn chicken so i got curious and gave it a try . it was old , dried and plus a weird medicine taste to it . i did not like it at all. and the rose green tea was bad .

This place is very easy on the eyes. The decor is done in soft shades of blue and silver and looks very modern. I don't get to go all that often since I don't reside in LV, but whenever I'm in town I do make it a point to drop in. 

My mom really likes the Coffee Milk Tea and gets it once or twice a week on her day(s) off. She  first took my sisters and me to this place on one of our trips to LV and one of my sisters became instantly obsessed. She thinks that the Jasmine Milk Tea here is by far the best she's ever had. That's coming from someone who lives in the San Gabriel Valley and who has exposure to such drinks on almost a daily basis. 

I've tried a couple of drinks from here. The Honey Iced Tea and Green Tea with Aloe. I can say they are pretty good. They also have snacks to munch on. We've ordered the hot wings, popcorn chicken, and squid balls. My other sister thought the hot wings were really tasty. Their prices aren't cheap and each drink is onwards of $3 (I really can't remember the exact pricing.) They also give you the option of getting it in medium or large. I usually get medium because of the calorie content and to save money, but really just get a large! 

While waiting for your drink, you can peruse teen magazines such as Seventeen and Teen Vogue (both were staples of mine back in the day) along with the most recent Avon and Avon Mark catalogs. 

The workers are mainly females in their teens to early twenties. Unlike other boba places they speak English fluently so there definitely won't be any type of language barrier.

 This is just my opinion but the reason this place is good can probably be attributed to the chain having originated in Taiwan. After all, boba is most definitely a Taiwanese invention.

We don't have any good Boba places in the DC Metro area so my husband planned a visit here as soon as we arrived in LV to visit our family.  It satisfied our craving bigtime without having to drive all the way to Chinatown.

The place was packed which we took as a good sign.  I had the Coconut Milk with Boba and my husband had the Mango with Boba. Both were excellent.  My husband who has been disappointed by numerous local boba places over the past few years almost had a tear in his eye after the first taste of his drink.

The staff was also quite friendly and didn't even laugh at me for spilling my drink all over the place when I put the straw in and accidentally broke my cup somehow (haha - only me!)

Used to go here all the time when I lived closer. The boba is always well done. I disliked the personalities of many of the girls. The friendly ones didn't seem to last long. Decent prices, good variety of flavors, and great quality of mixes. I frequent No 1 Boba near Smith's on Flamingo and Ft. Apache now.

I've tried 4 other boba places in Vegas and this is the best so far. They are generous with the boba and flavors are consistent. The have a no sugar added green tea which makes it a little less sweet for me, which is how i like it. The girls that work here are always nice.
It's small space but worker give us always welcome feeling & drinks are awesome! I love this place! :)
A trip to Las Vegas isn't complete without making a pit stop here! Absolutely love this place! Please bring more locations to the US!

This place has good milk tea and boba but it's not the real, high quality milk tea. It's just a bunch of flavored powder loaded with sugar. It's ran by a bunch of teenagers with less than good customer service. We've witnessed a couple of times not the most hygienic practices when it comes to preparing these drinks, oh well I'm sure I've had dirtier things without me knowing. 

The owner seems to care less and just wants to rake in the dough ....

Nooooooooooooooooo!!!!! They no longer sell Fluffy Snow!!! I haven't been here in a long time and they said they stopped selling it over a year ago. I drove all the way from San Diego for it!  I have no reason to come to Vegas anymore. I'm so bummed. They're drinks are still amazing.

They kick you out at 9pm sharp! 

When I got here at 8:45pm, they said they were out of boba. I don't know how a place with "boba" in their name doesn't have their namesake product. 

So I said alright and ordered some popcorn chicken. It took them nearly 10 minutes to make it. Keep in mind, I was the only customer and there were two employees working. So I start eating and less than 5 minutes later, they both tell me that they're closing so I have to leave. I ask if I can finish eating (I have about 6 pieces left at this point) and they say no because they have to go out back to throw away trash and they can't leave me alone in the front. What?!? 

The popcorn chicken itself was fine, but the service was horrendous.

This place always serves up my boba dericously. Seriously this place have good prices and I always get milk tea  but I'm kicking myself right now for getting advocado smoothie. -_- Even though I don't like it they made it pretty good so at least I can't deny the quality and flavor.
Very Happy with my Green Tea Boba Slush and Lobster Balls!   No line today very satisfied with service,too! I will definitely return!
My all-time favorite Boba place love their customer service so friendly so quick and best bobas :)

Mmmmmm!  My boyfriend and I stopped in tonight for "dessert" after dinner.  I got the Thai Tea Slush and he got the Coconut Milk Tea.  I kinda wish I would have gotten the large...I was sad when it was gone :(

This is definitely the place I go to get my boba fix! My favorites are jasmine milk tea, lichi green tea with lichi jelly, thai milk tea with egg pudding and taro milk tea. Staffs are friendly and their service is very fast too. I highly recommend this place!

This place is a little tricky to find. It's tucked away within the Von's parking lot range (if you walk out of Von's - it is directly across the way, close to the street).  I haven't had Boba since I moved to Vegas, and this hit the spot. Friendly staff, great prices, & great drink!!! I will definitely be back by this whenever I'm in the area.

This place is just ok. I tried the taro boba a small amount for like $5 and some change so I thought it was a bit pricey for a small boba drink. It was pretty good. A cute little hang out spot for teeny boppers.

Customer service sucks!

Came here with my family on a Monday around 8pm. There were 2 girls working. We ordered a thai tea slush and a strawberry banana smoothie. We paid for our drinks, tipped the girls, and waited while our drinks were being made. 

When one of the girls brought our drinks out, we noticed they had made us a regular iced thai tea rather than a thai tea slush. We told her that there was a mistake - and she just had this look of pure annoyance. She didn't apologize for the mistake or even said anything to us after we told her there was a mistake. All she did was go to the register to ring us up the price difference - a whopping 11 cents! Seriously? You're going to make us pay an 11 cent price difference on a mistake YOU made AND after we tipped your rude ass already? Whatever - we paid the 11 cents and waited for her to remake our drink. After she was done making our drink, she just put it on the counter without saying anything to us and walked away. We grabbed our drinks and got the hell out of there. 

Seriously, I wouldn't have minded paying the price difference if the girl was nice about it. At least apologize for the miscommunication or something.

Needless to say, we won't be back.

Always come here to get coconut milk boba, soooo delicious. 
Thai tea is also really good. Staff's friendly and quick. 
Definitely recommend if you like boba!

I come here every now and then, a couple days ago I went and received the worst customer service ever. The girl who took my order was making drinks at the same time, which made it hard for her to understand me, she clearly doesn't know how to multi task. She got my order wrong, I'm not surprised, so I ask her to fix it and she said I have to pay more, stupid girl. I'm never coming here ever again. Easy life employees can not handle a busy crowd.
Visiting Las Vegas for the first time and my friend wanted to take me here. Ordered the Peach Nana with boba. Very yummy! Quick, clean and friendly! Wish we had these back home.

Love it! Only reason why I cant up 5 stars is because there's been multiple times when I've entered the shop and NO ONE bothered to say greet me. I love the drinks tho.. I got an awesome groupon too just because i love my boba from there!

I use to go here all the time in high school when I lived nearby, and it's still my #1 to-go place whenever I'm craving boba and popcorn chicken. I know some people complain that the drinks are not sweet enough, but I like that it's not super sweet like some other boba places in Chinatown. I love their coconut milk tea and green apple green tea with green apple jelly. Their popcorn chicken is also a must-try, you get more chicken than batter (again, unlike some other boba places). This place would get five stars from me, but their service is inconsistent. Some days the girls who work there are nice, and other days they just look through you like a zombie.

Ok, so I gave them another try, and the same thing happened. I ordered the passion fruit green tea with boba, and the boba was undercooked again! (crunchy on the inside) I would not recommend going there unless you want something that does not contain boba.

I will admit that I was a little scared to visit because of some of the low reviews mentioning bad customer service.  After fighting with myself the previous night I decided I'm going to go ahead and go!  Maybe my experience won't be so bad?

Before going in I checked in with the yelp app. I was surprised to see that a $1 off a large drink popped up. Definitely going to use it on my drink. 

I came in around 11:45 am. There was one girl working behind the counter on a customers order. She greeted me hello with a smile as I came in. Good visit so far. After looking over the menu I settled on a fresh fruit strawberry banana smoothie with boba and rainbow jelly.  Also redeemed the $1 off coupon from yelp.

It was awesome!  I've never had rainbow jelly in my drink and its something I would order again. 

All in all I had a good visit with no problems.

This is a good local place to buy boba.  This is the cheapest boba place you can find in las vegas imo.  I go there when i don't have to go to work.  My favorite is their mango flavored green tea and taro + red bean slush.  

I don't know why their boba (tapioca) recently taste really bad.  I think it's not chewy anymore.  It's hard in the center and the exterior is soaked in water too long.  It's basically nasty.  I never get to eat fresh boba like what they used to make.  They probably changed the manufacturer of their boba.   I think i'm going to stop getting boba in my drinks and just get the usual mango green tea wihtout the boba. They used to charge 35¢ for boba now they charge 50¢ extra for boba as of October 2008.

They have tables there if anyone wants to study there. However I cannot notice the fact that they have white chairs and they never clean them.  You can literally see the black stains on the chair.  THis is a turn off for me to ever go there to study.  

Oh yea one more comment, the employees there are excellent.  They are very prompt when you first walk in, they will ask you for your order, and make it right away without hesitation.  They will stop doing anything and just serve the customers that walk through the door.  The owner which is a chubby asian female, doesn't have much customer service skills.  Often times, she is rude.  She doesn't smile, she doesn't say thank you.  All i ask is recognition of her customers, but i guess customers to her is just like............ the rush hour, GET IN and SHIP THEM OUT.  I hope she would find out some day and hopefully this will knock into her.  I just hate it when i see her there.  She probably lost a lot of customers cuz of her existence.
I love their Taro Boba Slushy. Its freaking great. Its an alternative to Starbucks but its not cheap!

It was love at first sip with the watermelon slush with boba! It was like I was drinking fresh watermelon, if you are a watermelon lover then I highly recommend it. I wandered in after going to the bank. The selection is impressive, there is a lot of choices.  It was not too cold for a slush which I appreciate.I will most definitely be back to try some different options!!!!

This little place is always busy.  Their flavor selections and drink choices are significant.  Their service is friendly, and the prices are reasonable.  They have limited seating, but seems to be enough.  I look forward to going back and trying more of their selections!
They were quick and drinks weren't a bad price. Clean place and fast and friendly service!

So I can say this place took my Boba Drink virginity. My friend took me here and was suprised I never heard or had a Boba Drink before. He suggested that this place is the best Boba place he's been to. So I walk in really confused not knowing what to get. The cashier gave up 2 samples one being the Jasmine tea which was gross. Then he gave me a sample of the Milk tea which I loved. I decided I wanted to keep it healthy so I went with a smoothie. I got the Kiwi Banana Smoothie w/ Boba in it. My friend got the Milk Tea Boba. 

Well I can say I'm absolutely hooked on Boba now. Mine was pretty damn good. So good I wanted some more of my friends, his was tasty too. I'll be back. Really wanna try the Milk Tea one next.
Really good boba spot. I love the red bean slush, taro red bean slush, and the coffee slush. Their popcorn chicken is good as well. My coworkers love the Thai slush.
Thr best boba tea in town.  The service is fast and friendly.

O M G this is the best place in town for a Boba Tea drink. I have tried a good handful of places here and this one has the best tasting and the best customer service at least on Sunday's when I go. Would highly recommend anyone to try it out.
Literally asked for a passion fruit tea with rainbow jelly and right when I got my card swiped I was given back my card and also my drink. Extremely fast service. It's lit!!

Their drinks are delicious, no matter what you order. Their fluffy snow is also interesting. It's not bad, it just cannot be compared to sorbet or shaved ice because it's texture is far from either. By the way, the small for fluffy snow can feed two or even three when it's not to-go!

Quick service. But drinks were ok, not great. The coconut slush is clearly made from artificial flavoring. I was so disappointed because since we moved to Vegas, I've been looking for a similar coconut shake that I had from Cyclo Noodles in Long Beach, CA.

The only thing cuter than the drinks are the girls who work here.


The Boba and various teas here are wonderful.  One of my favorite drinks would have to be the lemon-honey tea, because its a grownup-kid drink, like a Shirley Temple, full of booze.  

The store is quaint and clean, with some good music usually playing at an appropriate level.  On a nice day, you can sit at the table outside and enjoy your drink.  Service is fairly quick, and the plastic wrap on top of your drink makes it very convenient to take on the go. 

This is my favorite Boba spot in town, not just because the crush-worthy staff greets you with smiles, but because they know what they're doing, and they do it right.
Great place to hangout just to sit and drink boba with my girls here. Its not crowded and service is friendly.
OMG!  This place is so good.  Clean and very friendly staff.  You have to try their FLUFFY SNOW when you come here.  And the lobster balls were good too......

Loved the Thai tea slush with boba but just recently discovered the jasmine milk tea with boba! The lychee tea was pretty good but a little too sweet especially when you add lychee jelly to it. The kids loved the strawberry banana slush and chocolate with boba. It's conveniently close to my area but still far so I don't end up going everyday. The girls behind the counter are always polite and nice.
I love their Milk tea, I wish they would stay open a little longer. The boba isnt the best but the milk tea i can drink all day!

Awesome drinks - most especially the ones with boba! Taro slush is yummy - tastes like milk you have at the bottom of your bowl of fruity pebbles cereal! Green tea slush is also my fav and both with boba!

MY GO-TO BOBA SPOT. This place is so underrated which is confusing to me, because this is as consistent as it gets! I've been here at least a dozen times and not only is my order always on point, but it's the same friendly service too. This is my go-to because I love that for just $0.85 more, you can get a jumbo size! (Check in on Yelp and you get $1.00 off anyway!)

I've tried multiple things on the menu, such as the thai iced tea, mango slush, lychee green tea, etc... but my consistent order: 
- MATCHA GREEN TEA SLUSH WITH EXTRA BOBA. Never disappoints! 

*They also have fishballs, squid balls and shrimp balls -- which is the perfect little paired snack with boba. (I enjoyed them all, but if I had to choose? Shrimp balls were my favorite.) ^__^

I love the fact that this location is literally behind our home!  It's never too busy like most of the Boba cafe in Chinatown.  Price is reasonable and a bit more selection.  They also take credit cards, which I love because I don't always carry cash!  

And it is located around some great Asian restaurants...great stop after dinner for some drink dessert or shaved ice!

This is a pretty great boba place, really it is especially after considering how convenient it is. Most decent boba shops are down Spring Mountain Road, which can get to be very congested and difficult to naviagte, but Easy Life Boba isn't too far away and the streets aren't narrow. 

I've been to the place enough times to deduce that the Thai Tea Slush is my favorite. Generally, I love the rose milk tea bobas but I think that the slush is better here. My friend also had tried the Lava Flow (I believe that is the name) and loved it because it resembled a piña colada with strawberries and boba pearls.

The only reason it's a four star is due to the fact that the snacks were alright. The shrimp ball was overly salted and the lobster ball wasn't as bad.

I know you're probably thinking, 'Why is she commenting on the snacks when this place is clearly meant for boba?' Well, that's because if they would like to put up the options of a snack then the snack should be pretty good but it was overly salty almost inedible. 

It might've been a fluke but the shrimp ball were just overly salty and the texture wasn't the most pleasent either.

Overall the boba is great, just not the snacks.

It's been a while since I reviewed this, I usually like to try places more than once to see if they're consistent with my last review & happy to say Easy Life remains my fave Boba place!

I try to get different flavors every time I'm here & seriously, every single one tasted fresh, creamy & delicious! 

Service is always friendly too! Nothing else to say. Craving their Boba as I type this. :)

I loveeeee their slushy boba!!! I always order pineapple & mango & it just taste delish... It's not too watery & it's blended well!!! I love how fresh it taste & they also sell little snacks like lobster ball or egg rolls etc! Highly recommend it if you live around the area! I'm planning on going there tomorrow cause I've been wanting it the past couple days
My favorite is the passion fruit slushy ! I've never had a bad experience. Everyone is always nice and they serve the best boba teas (;

This was one of my favorite boba places. However, my last trip there just made me to write a review... Very upset.... Can't add sea salt cream on the jumbo size drink? But you did add it on my last drink... that's BS... And I will get you in trouble? Hello? If your customer is not satisfied, you're in trouble!!!! I'm totally not satisfied, and I'm gonna pay for it!!!! Super upset... Because it was one of my favorite places, so I gave 2 starts

I finally made the trip out here the other day. The place has a dope modern look inside. There are some tables so you can sit and kick back, but I just ordered mine to go since I had to go to class. 

I ordered a large Almond Milk Tea w/boba. It was good. The milk tea tasted just right. The boba could be cooked a little more though. I will mos def come back to try one of their fresh fruit drinks.

I find the high ratings for this place to be completely baffling. Maybe I came in on a bad night, you know, someone being off their game. But, I think 2 stars is pretty generous if you ask me, why? This was probably the worst bubble tea i've ever had. Ever.

I was in the area and was checking around for some new bubble tea places that were closeby. After seeing the high ratings, I decided to check it out. The inside of the store is pretty nice. It's clean and well maintained. Things started to go downhill after ordering a bubble tea.

Large Milk tea w boba and egg pudding and caramel- Let's start with the boba. It was not well cooked. It was mushy on the outside and hard in the middle. Definitely disappointed. The egg pudding was ghastly. It was way too soft. By the time it gets sucked through the straw, it disintegrates into a cottage cheese like texture. I almost wanted to puke. The milk tea had 0% tea flavor, it might as well have been water. And finally the cherry on top would be the caramel. They use the Torani brand caramel syrup. Yes, the same caramel syrup they use at Starbucks to flavor their drinks. I mean, come on. It was terrible.

It should have been 1 star but I gave them an extra star because the total was 4 bucks with the yelp check in offer. But, not coming back.
Absolutely mediocre. I order honeydew milk tea but you could still taste the powder. All you had to do was shake it more.

Out of all the boba (bubble tea) places in Vegas, I'd have to say this is my favorite. 
Quality drinks that are well-priced. 
I really like the tapioca in their drinks because they are fresh and not mushy or hardened like many places I have been to. 
The boba here is relatively cheap compared to places like Tea Station and Volcano Tea, and to be honest, I think Easy Life's drinks taste much better.

My favorites:

- Jasmine or Almond Milk Tea with Tapioca (if you want something classic)
- Coconut Slush with Coffee Jelly (a must!)

And on an endnote-- the service is awesome!

I have been to this place multiple times! Every time is a great experience. There are so many good teas and slushes, etc to choose from. If I ever want to study or just grab a quick boba mile tea for the road, I always come here. Thank you for your great services.

0I love trying different types of boba places, this one happens to be right next door. Maybe I have yet to explore other flavors at this place since Ive only been once but I wasnt really a fan.

I ordered their thai tea which was one of their top picks. It came out within a minute. The drink wasnt as cold. The drink wasnt as flavorful and tasted slightly watered down. Perhaps other flavors may save my review. Im definitely willing to go back to try something else and update this review.

The location is clean and the staff was friendly. I feel that the inside decor could find more of a central theme or character to draw customers in. 

I just feel like they have tons of potential to make this boba stop unique. Places like these should be upbeat and colorful. Id like to see this place really embrace what it means to be easy life for them. Seems like such a laid back kind of place, Id like to see more of that too. 

Well again, hoping to return and try other flavors and perhaps indulge in some of their appetizers. Ill be back!

We frequent Easy Life Boba anytime we are in the area, and/or really craving a delicious, refreshing drink!!  I always get the same thing, which is a peach slush, they are great for hot summer days and nights here in Vegas!!  I don't recommend hanging out there in the shop, it is very hot in my opinion!!   Maybe this is just due to the sweltering summer heat...who knows, or by design to give extra incentive to get an ice cold drink once inside?  Either way, don't let that persuade you not to try one!!  Definitely a must try for all Boba Lovers out there!!

This is my go-to boba place near my house. Its not as busy as Icy Juicy or Tea Planet which is what I like when I just want to get a drink for myself and leave. They have some small snacks and what not but I never got those. Drinks are made very well and the boba has a good consistency. The service is on and off sometimes the girls are nice sometimes they're eh. Overall, still a good place to grab boba!

I LOVE THIS PLACE.

Best prices and they have the best Honey Milk Tea in the city. We come here so often the cashiers know our orders as soon as we walk in.

The fluffy snow is also really good. Awesome in the summer! 

GO. GO. GO.

Not a bad choice if you are craving boba on this side of town. This location is near the southwest part of town, fairly close to desert breeze park.

Ordered a safe choice - large milk tea with boba. I don't like how the large cup size is wide.  It doesn't fit in my car's cup holder. The taste is very similar to volcano tea's milk tea. Sweet enough for my taste, not overpowering. And the chewiness of the boba is just right.

The service was friendly and the place itself is roomy and clean. I believe they have a rewards program but I didn't ask for details because I don't see myself coming back too often. But if I'm in the neighborhood, I'd stop by again if i don't want to drive all the way to Chinatown for boba :)
Called them to find out about whether they used fresh fruit drove all the way over here to find out its canned juice fruit not fresh fruit...  Come on people.  Poor service poor quality smells stale

I hit up this boba tea place for a treat after the Yelp Surfset workout. In keeping with the island-y theme of our workout, I went for the coconut slush with lychee. And then at the cashier's urging, added boba. 

While the flavors of my drink were quite fresh and tropical, it was a bit too much in one drink. And at nearly $7, it set me back more than I'd expected.

I'd recommend the order, as it tasted good, but maybe stick to just the lychee or the boba instead of doing both.

That being said, there's a lot on their menu that I'm interested in trying: thai tea with boba, in particular, but also a new/featured special peanut butter milk tea? I might be back sooner than I expected.
Boba was good. I got a honey milk tea with egg pudding and boba. It was just a little too sweet.

Love their milk teas.  I'm not much into slushies so the 5 star is just for that.  Also for their location - its comfortable & conducive to studying (if there's not a long line of somewhat loud people ordering).  It also helps that there's free wifi :)   They did away with their 'frequent guest' stamp program that gives you a free drink of your choice.  I dont know how well the new program rewards loyal customers but other than that, its great!

I have only been here once but enjoyed my visit in all. I have been to a lot of Boba places, and this is one I'd add to my favorites list. I ordered the Slushy Taro Boba and it was great! I couldn't tell if it was made with real taro or powdered, but it was delicious. What was a great bonus for me is my tapioca pearls were still warm. Yummy :) I visited the store during the night hours, so it wasn't that busy, the parking lot is big enough, so there were no problems there. One of the problems I have with most Boba drink places here in Vegas is they only accept cash, but this store does accept cards. The service there was amazing, the two young ladies working there made you feel welcome upon entering the store. I will be back!!!

We frequent this place because it's by the house. Boba is good. Lots of flavors etc. They almost always have some deal going on which is cool. I get the text alerts and end up using them probably about half the time. 
Kids that work there are nice. Always see a familiar face. Thing that doesn't take that to 5 stars is the cleanliness. It's filthy... It looks like they are diligent in cleaning the blenders etc that part looks clean... I hope. But the store it self looks like it hasn't been cleaned or updated since it opened. Wall decal is literally peeling and falling off the wall.The counter you stand at to get your drink has these nasty dusty, some broken, lights hanging and the counter, wall and ceiling are covered with old... very old dusty splatters of some random boba tea. There are even some old dusty stains from drips down the counter that have literally been there since we've been coming and that's been a few years. My son thinks it's funny  that, "the drip is still there!" When we are having to sit and stare at it while waiting for our drinks. See the many kids that work there reading, eating, chilling at that far table when we walk in... They might want to get some rags out and clean up instead.
The best boba tea place on this side of town. They have very creative combinations of drinks. I wish they would open in Henderson.

First things first, THEY HAVE THE BEST POPCORN CHICKEN IN TOWN! I love how it's so close to the dog park, so when my friends and I are done with puppy play date, we come here! Its unfortunate they don't allow dogs inside anymore even though our dogs are well behaved and chill. I mean, a dog park is right across the street and especially during summertime I'm sure people want to grab some boba after taking their dogs out. 
I always order the Thai tea here, and what's so good about this place is they have the wide large size, like who wouldn't want more bang for their buck?! Their boba is always fresh and squishy, workers here look like they work hard and they're extremely friendly. Amazing customer service and drinks, even better popcorn chicken!

Great neighborhood place to stop and get your Boba Life on ! 

For the adventurers there's the avocado boba! 

But for me it's the Watermelon fresh fruit, yum yum! 

There is a small patio outside but it gets hot!

Um.. They only give a little bit of popcorn chicken for 4.99..... And honestly very dissatisfied. It was good but they shouldn't be that stingy with their chicken if they're gonna put it in that big of a bag. Plus, they messed up on my cousin's order.. They were about to give my cousins's food order to the person that was AFTER her. But luckily she went up to them and asked why I haven't gotten my order. They should start calling out NUMBERS instead of what we bought. So people wouldn't get so confused.

Came here a little after they opened. No one was there and i love the sizes of the containers you get your moneys worth. I tried their taro milk tea with boba i love how it's not tooooooooooo sweet, it's perfect. Their boba isn't chewy tho the only downside. It was kinda hard, but all in all, great service!

this review is only on the fluffy snow since i don't buy boba from here (yet).  first of all.. i think this is the only place you can get fluffy snow in las vegas.  the ice is fine and light unlike ice cream, so it doesn't make you feel like crap after you eat it.  if you've ever been to fluff ice in california, then you get the kind of fluffy snow that i'm talking about.  there are three flavors: thai tea, strawberry, and mango.  then, you can choose two categories of toppings and a syrup.  i usually get thai tea snow, banana, mochi, and condensed milk (a combo i highly recommend!) in small, which costs five dollars and some change.  this price might scare you but it's actually pretty huge since i usually eat a third of it before getting full and then i take it home and put it in the freezer.  the thai tea is a little on the sweeter side though so i try not to eat this so much. i haven't tried the fruity flavors of snow yet because i'm not a big fan of fruit flavored ice cream..

actually, the thing that i am most enthusiastic about here is the customer service.  tonight i went and bought my usual thai tea fluffy snow and it came out messy and partially melted.  this didn't bother me that much so i just started eating it.  then.. the boss came out and took one look at my cup and started making me a new one (without me needing to say anything!).  i didn't know that he was already making me a new one until the meltyness started to bother me and i went to the cashier to complain.  with this kind of customer service, i walked out content and with two cups of thai tea fluffy snow in my hands.  yay!

Amazing tasting milk teas and Bobbas and puddings! Second time at this joint and I am very happy to report that they have not lost their touch, in fact they got better, at least in my opinion. 
We came here straight from dinner at a Shabu-shabu joint. We live way on the other side of town, opposite ends, but the drive was well worth the greatness of these teas. 
The service was fast, no fuss, and it was not so busy on a Wednesday night, which was alright with me since we did not have to wait long. 
The ambience of the place is very peaceful and quaint. It's a good way to spend some quality time drinking tea and catching up with friends. 
I SUPER-DUPER RECOMMEND THIS PLACE TO EVERYONE! If you live far like I do, it's really worth the drive. ENJOY!

One of my favorite boba shops! You can't go wrong with Easy Life. I've come here plenty of times and tried tons of drinks and am always pleased with my order. Aside from all the flavors & drinks, they have delicious snacks and even shaved snow! YUM! 

You can also call ahead & specify when you will be picking up and then will have your order ready for you. So convenient! 

The staff is always friendly and the place is pretty clean. Definitely will keep coming here with my family.

I HAVE TO GIVE THIS PLACE 5 STARS. They have always been so good to their customers since the year they've opened. Their boba comes in many different sizes so you have variety, they also have a LARGE size for if you want your drink extra big lol but their boba is just always fresh and their drinks are always stellar  and to also add THEIR FISH BALLS ARE SO FREAKING DELICIOUS! They actually make their fish balls really spicy (how I like it) and they never disappoint. In fact today I may even go just to get some fish balls and maybe a Thai tea boba (btw their Thai tea is FUEGO ) they also do frappes now I think like caramel fraps. This place does have wifi and little game machines if you get bored. The inside is very clean and spacious, interior is designed decent. The service is never that great but it's never really crappy so service is mediocre but other than that, their food and their drinks are worth a try id def recommend

It was a little busy so I had to wait to place my order but that was fine because I couldn't decide what to get.  They have so many different options.  When I reached the counter I asked if she would recommend the honey milk tea or the vanilla milk tea?  She gave me a sample of the milk tea and I decided to go with the honey milk tea w/ boba.  I also wanted an iced tea and went with the melon iced tea w/ boba.  I enjoyed both drinks and will return.

They girls that work here are awesome. They're always helpful, smiling, and they make great drinks. I've tasted the cappuccino blended boba drink, so good! I also like their thai tea and their avocado smoothie so bomb dot com.

-Ozzy Lopez

I'm a huge fan of boba, and I'm so happy to say that Easy Life Boba has some of the best boba in Vegas. They have so many different options and everything is priced reasonably. Definitely check this place out.

Very good boba and flavors. ;) 
Wish they had a rewards card cause I'm always there! Avocado is fresh and not that medicine powder tasting stuff.

Pudding boba milk tea;) finally got their rewards card the sign they have up makes it seem like you hv to pay $20 for it but you only pay .50 for it and they scan it on every visit.. I wish I would have asked from the beginning!
I walked it and the girl asked me right away if I wanted the usual which was nice;) 
I regret getting the jumbo size for the milky drink large would hv been just fine its just that I can never hv enough of their rose tea and wish they sold it by the gallon

Tried this place out for the first time yesterday since the hubby was craving boba, and it was the closest one on our way home. I got the honey lemon tea, while he got the strawberry tea. My drink okay, not overly sweet, and had a hint of a rosy aftertaste, probably from the tea. His tea, however, sucked pretty badly. First they got his order wrong and gave him a strawberry milk tea. It would have been okay had his drink tasted good, but it tasted terrible. Despite him not wanting to, I forced him to take it back since it was their mistake anyway. They finally gave him his strawberry tea, but to his disappointment, it tasted like faucet water with an over abundance of sweetener. It was so bad that he threw his drink away after only a couple of sips. Maybe it's just us since we are used to the quality of tea we get at QQ boba in henderson, but this place really isn't worth coming back to.

I've been to Easy Life a good amount of times, due to the fact that I work SUPER close to it, and I have never been disappointed by it.

I'm working my way through their menu, today I had a banana smoothie that was very good, not sure if I'd order it again though, I believe it was made with whipped cream in it, which left a weird texture in my mouth...

All the teas I've had so far have been really good. AAND you can get different types of toppings instead of just boba....like pudding balls or coconut jelly... And one of these days I'm going to try the Aloe Vera. 

They also have lobster and squid balls which are really interesting and worth a try!
Quick service and the boba is bomb. I highly suggest. You will definitely enjoy any type of boba you get.

We had:
1.) Lychee Slushy with Boba 
- It was good. 
2.) Popcorn Chicken 
- It was good, but I like the popcorn chicken in Tapioca Express in California better. 
3.) Shrimp Balls 
- I like theirs better than any other boba places I've been to. 
4.) Strawberry Fluffy Snow with Mochi, Mango Jelly and Condensed Milk 
- I really like it because it's like shaved ice, but it's not. (I usually don't like shaved ice.) The texture is interesting. The small size is already good for 2-3 people. I'd go back here again for this. 

Service is nice and fast. It's in a strip mall so not much activity on a weekday afternoon. Place is clean. Plenty of parking.

Used to come here all the time when I worked in the complex at a dental office and when my hubby's business was down the street. We came here so much they knew his order-honey milk tea with boba. My order always changed, taro slush, taro milk, strawberry milk tea, watermelon slush, Thai tea..... because we came so often the girls were always super nice to us. Still are, just a little more shy? We don't come multiple times a week anymore..... but when we are on this side we make a trip here. Their shaved ice is really good, melts in your mouth, kinda pricey, we just stick with the Boba drinks.

Haven't found an item that we don't like. It's not a huge suprise but they have a high turn over rate. With that being said I give 4 stars because new employees usually aren't as knowledgeable or efficient. I recommend the popcorn chicken, delicious. The family also likes the lobster balls.

My favorite place in Vegas for boba. My favorites are the milk tea, taro tea and watermelon slush. They have a rewards card system. For every $50 you spend you get $5 back. The people who work there are very nice.

This is the place that I've been looking for, a right place to hang out, but i wish that they could open 24 hrs, that would be awesome!
The drinks are very tasty, yummy flavors.
i cant really complain about their food.
I lived over the north side of the town, but i never go any place else for whatever reasons!
Great place to get boba! The boba is perfectly soft. I just wish they haven't taken out the snow Ice :(
I got the jasmine milk tea. Boba was perfect but the drink was decent. Service was good.

I've been to several boba tea places around the Las Vegas/Henderson area and this is definitely one of my go-to places - I'm lucky it's by my job, too!

I just happened to go in here one day with a boba craving and got it fulfilled.  They have rather large cups and their coconut milk tea is superb.  Boba has been cooked to perfection the times I have been here and it doesn't take them long to make this little piece of drink heaven so I can drink it as slowly as possible - which is not slow at all.  Mmm.  Staff is always super friendly and cheerful.

Had their chicken nuggets here one time - nothing to write home about but decent enough considering it's a boba tea shop.  Of course, I come for the boba.  Hee hee.

Keep up the good work, guys!  I hope to continue to frequent your awesome place~

Been coming here for years. Boba is life, and the texture of their boba is perfect. As a student, I use to come here often to study. Im happy with ordering their Pearl milk tea with pudding (extra boba). They have small, medium, and, jumbo option. The only bad thing about the jumbo option, is that the cup does not fit in any cup holder. Every once in a while I'll order their lobster balls which you can request mild or spicy. I'm pretty sure I've been to almost all boba spots in town and Easy Life falls under my top 3.

This is one of the places I go to when I was in high school. The BEST boba joint I still love to go till now. Their drinks are very delicious and not too sweet (if requested). The boba is on point, not too hard or soft just perfect! The employees are always nice and helpful. This boba store have many variety of flavors to drink but can also mix different flavors if you can't decide on one. If you don't want sugar or milk in your drink..the employees always have different option to make it. Which is a plus if your picky like me lol Also, this place have FREE wifi! I think this is one of the boba place that is open for a while and never disappoint me. I will always love my coconut/strawberry smoothie with extra boba!

Yummy the avocado smoothie is so amazing!! So delicious the girls that work here are really nice this place can get really busy though but they have a pretty good selection on drinks and they also have a cup size in JUMBO which is the one I get all the time due to my love for BOBA
I asked them to make Thai iced coffee for me even though it wasn't on the menu and they did! It was perfect.

I got to credit my wife by finding this place literally on the fly and this has to be one of her most spontaneous finds, but it paid off immensely! 

So located within a decent sized shopping area/strip mall lies Easy Life and go figure as we were picking up food at a restaurant next to this my wife yells "BOBA" and decides to Yelp it and from there the rest is history! 

I love how more and more the Vegas Yelp community is leading us to these hidden marvels and further away from dismal experiences on the Strip. Although the mom's and pop's of the world certainly need love too and heck most of the time they wipe the palette with world renowned chefs so kudos all around!

Although I didn't go in physically my wife kept rambling on and on about the variety of the menu and from looking at their webpage the menu does seem to include everything but the kitchen sink. Oh wait, I saw that on there as a slush with boba. Ha-ha! I do want to make an outing and try some of their snack items so perhaps this portion will be a pending review in the near future?!?

For the purposes of this review, I went again to what I refer to as my "go-to" drink, the taro milk tea. Quite simply, they know how to prepare this sucker right off the bat as it was one of the better ones I've had to date. I know with other locations back in California there is a disclaimer "made to taste", but it's more impressive when a place doesn't have to do that to pump out a drink. It was the perfect blend of sweet, but not overly sweet to give me the diabetic shakes. The boba itself was chewy which I admit I'm a fan of and the best think that stuck out was the freshness of the boba. At times I run into some that taste thawed out or maybe left out past its shelf life, but not here. 

If this is what the easy life tastes like then count me IN! This does make me feel much better knowing that when I am here in the summer months for one that there is a one stop destination for boba and boba accessories (I do hope someone at least gets the Hank Hill reference or I'll feel like a total nut case). 

I will see you very soon (mid April) for sure to continue with the bobalicious consumption and possibly a popcorn chicken/lobster ball outing as well!
Favorite boba place in town. I come here 3-4 times a week &  try something new almost every time. Best milk teas, slushes, and smoothies in Las Vegas. Seriously go try, you won't regret it!

Wanting a nice refreshing drink?

No, not starbucks. (There will be a long ass line)
No, not Jamba juice (I have enough fruit in my life)

A boba drink! This is the only boba drink I enjoy. Most are over powering and syrupy. YUCK. I have found this place to make the perfect drink. 

You can get boba added to many of the different drink options. My favorite you ask? Chocolate shake with boba added. It only comes to 4 bucks and is crazy big. I NEVER finish it. Drink is always icey, yet creamy. They put a lot of boba but theres never too much. I still get a good amount of drink.

Favored drinks; medium is only 3 bucks and large is 3.50. They have many flavored drinks; Strawberry, Passion Fruit, Grapefruit, Orange, Peach, Grape, Kiwi, Lichi, Blueberry, Honeydew, Pineapple, Green Apple, and fruit tea. 

Milk teas come in different flavors as well; Jasmine,  Coffee, Almond, Pudding, Vanilla, Strawberry, Thai, Honey and more. medium is 3.00 and large is 3.65.

Slushies are better than 7-eleven. Probably because they have way more variety. Mediums is 3.25. large is 3.75. Next time I want to try the lemon. 

Whats best is they have a loyalty card. After so many you get a free drink. AWESOME

They have snacks you can munch on as you sit and drink or get on your computer. (yes free wifi) Popcorn chicken (3.99) cajun wings (4.59) chicken nuggets (3.99) shrimp ball (4 piece 1.99, 8 piece 3.89) Lobster ball (4 piece 1.99, 8 piece 3.89) Squid ball (4 piece 1.99, 8 piece 3.89) Fish ball (4 piece 1.99, 8 piece 3.89). havent tried them but they do look fresh and yummy.

The young workers (high schoolers i think, or just young looking) are always very friendly and willing to answer any and all questions. Give it a try, it will not disappoint.

When I was a teenager, Easy Life was just the boba place you went to because all the "good" places were in China Town. That was a long bus ride for some boba and even when a car was procured - who had the gas money for that kind of trip on the daily? Then, what seemed like overnight, cool hipster boba places opened everywhere, and Easy Life was left behind by many like me.

I was a fool! I came back the other day for convenience when I was craving a treat and got my usual Jasmine Milk Tea w/boba and felt utterly blown away by how delicious it tasted. I had gotten so used to the taste of other establishments it was a completely rediscovered experience for me. I can't say they have the best boba ever, but I can say with absolute confidence their Jasmine Milk Tea is my favorite in Las Vegas. 

That being said, convenience is primary over atmosphere here! They really should have a drive-thru because they are not the first place I would want to stop for a chat. Usually, if I do stay and drink I sit on one of the two outside tables which are made of metal. Not ultimately comfy but good enough. 

For the last few weeks, their fryer has been broken, and it will be for several more weeks. I need lobster balls!! This needs to be fixed ASAP! Lol.

My FAVORITE place to get Boba!  The girls that work there are always pretty friendly ! i go here at least once a week for my Jasmine Milk tea with boba and my husband gets a strawberry smoothie... Just a quick, cheap treat! Keep up the good work!

Came here yesterday after lunch at Sidestreet Pho next door. I'd say that Easy Life is decent. Definitely not my go-to boba shop, but service is always quick and it was convenient. As for the boba itself, I have only tried the jasmine milk tea, pearl milk tea, and Thai milk tea. Out of the three, the pearl is probably my favorite...however, the teas here are very milky to the point where they taste watery. The boba is soft and chewy but there is no sweetness to them. 

Easy Life is not bad if you're craving boba and are in the area, but personally I wouldn't make a trip solely to pay a visit here.

Love this place! Always my go-to boba spot. They've got a small, medium, and jumbo option. Lots of tea options to choose from, including slushies, milk teas etc., a small menu you can order food from, and friendly staff!
Iv been going here for years and they never disappoint! So many options for drinks and food. The service is always friendly, and it's very clean.

Authentic selection of Teas, along with juices and smoothies. The staff was friendly and efficient. Pricing was a bit high but nothing out of the ordinary. Interior was very clean, bright and spacious. The menu is extensive but asking for a sample is encouraged. Check in using Yelp and get a discount.
Love love love this place! I like the teas better than the blended boba drink. They have diff kinds of flavors. Sooooo good!
Yummy yummy bobba!! The chicken is good ; I guess I just like the chicken from tapioca better.

So freaking good! They'll let you try samples if you ask. I tried a regular milk tea sample and it tastes similar to jamocha. Super good and it was fun to try something new as I usually stick to what I like with the passion fruit green tea. The Thai milk tea is fantastic too! I want to try every flavor, seriously. And this is the first place I've seen with a giant size and that's so darn awesome!! 

It's about $3-4 for the medium. And the ladies are super helpful and friendly. They make the drinks so quickly. I'll be back again and again when I visit!

Update*
Upgrade to 5 stars - cannot find a better boba (or bubble tea, as I used to call it)!!   And to include in my update:  Lobster Balls!  What are these fried balls o'goodness exactly - I don't care.  Went for medium spicy and I like spicy - don't want to try the really spicy as am afraid I wouldn't get any of the lobster taste.  Great combo with the boba if you want a little bite to eat.

Good boba place that has fair pricing. Was greeted upon entering and was helpful about questions I had. Wait time was very short for two drinks (maybe 3 min) and it tastes great! I got the green tea slush and my husband got the strawberry banana smoothie. Pleasant atmosphere and the claw machine is so cute! 
Also their wide cups are unique and idk why I love them so much. 
Love that there is a boba place here because most of them are all the way in china town!

WHERE: Dessert Inn & Durango, in the plaza where Vons is!

WHY: This is my new favorite boba spot! I have been convinced!

WHAT: After reading a couple reviews of this place, I opened up my google maps, and headed on a mission to get some 5-STAR boba!

I am a smoothie & milk tea with boba type of girl!! I have been looking for the perfect boba spot that I would call home, and I am going to have to say EUREKA, I FOUND IT! Haha.

The flavors I have tried so far were the mango slush, taro milk tea, and almond milk tea, and I stay satisfied! Not only were the drinks flawless, the boba was the perfect consistency!! Not too hard, nor too soft = just to my liking!

If you are extremely thirsty, there is a JUMBO size for additional $0.80! If that were me, it would take me an hour or so just to finish it! It already takes me close to an hour to finish the large sized drink!! The large also seems larger than other boba spots. The prices are really great for what you get back! Don't let your googly eyes fool you!! If the large and or jumbo is too much for you, it's okay because you can save it for later!

So I leave you with this- 
Drive, bike or walk there,
Order to your liking,
Institute your love for the deliciousness,
Thank the makers!!

Just DO IT! =D

This is the place where I first discovered the coffee  jelly per recommendation of the girl that took my order. Little did she know that she started a really bad addiction for me! I get it with almost all drinks I get instead of tapioca pearls now. 

I only order one of two things from here, regular Milk Tea and Cappuccino Slush, both highly compatible with my coffee jelly. Both tasteful, and perfectly made every time. 

I also order the lobster balls and/or fish balls from their food/snack menu. Honestly, I'm not a fan of spicy so the lobster balls are a little bit of a kick for me. I struggle eating it but I don't really care because it's that good! The fishballs on the other hand is pretty basic but filling nonetheless. 

Some indoor seating, two tables outdoors and chairs for those who are waiting. Spacious, but not very decorated. This place need to liven up more but it's okay just the way it is also. 

Hope they open one on my side of town! SOUTH EAST please.

The staff: I haven't gone consistently recently.  Always a new face but I'm sure there's a steady staff.  They're quick.  And no uniform? They must be happy campers.

The goods: Probably my favorite place to get boba.  Everywhere else got so pricy.  Plus this is just down the street.  It's nice not to have to go all the way to China Town for some boba.  I think my favorite is the vanilla milk tea.  Nom nom nom :)

The atmosphere: You know, I think they should expand.  And advertise maybe?  I think they should become a place to loiter; not just purchase your boba then you're on the run again.  They leave out a few magazines, minor initiative to hang around for a bit.  And there's wifi available, but I think they have the potential to be a really thriving company.  Not to say that they aren't already; I just think it could do a lot more considering they've got a good product, good clientele, friendly (and familiar, since every Asian in this town knows each other) staff.  I'd like to see them doing exceptionally well.

And now I really want a Thai Tea with boba but I don't think they're open at 7:30 in the morning :P
Best boba place!!! Love the drink selection awesome...Taro Milk Tea with boba the bomb

Jasmine milk tea why you gotta taste so damn good?! I am in love!

I really thought Kung Fu Tea had my soul with their oolong milk tea, but this Jasmine milk tea is serious competition. The jasmine flavor is steeped strong and very aromatic. Not bitter in the slightest with a wonderful floral aroma. The milk tea wasn't too strong or too watery, it was perfect.

My fiancé tried the original milk tea and it's tasty too! The boba was cooked fresh and still hot, so I sampled a little bit. Unfortunately, it was still too soft and mushy for my personal taste, so I opted out on the boba. I typically get grass jelly or herbal jelly to replace bunk boba, but they don't offer any jelly here, they do however offer egg pudding.

The drinks are awesome but my hugest complaint and why you don't see me frequenting this place is because their hours are terrible! I hate that they close so early - 9pm is just too damn early in Vegas.

I've been on a bit of a boba kick in the past 24 hours (I grabbed some last night and again this afternoon). I came in with my two kids for a treat and ordered a large coconut milk tea with pudding. The larges here are gigantic and really cost efficient. I love it! The three of us shared this drink and all got our sugary fix for the day.

The coconut milk tea was delicious and creamy and I LOVE PUDDING from boba places. I actually never get boba in my drinks because I'm not big on chewing drinks, but pudding has the most fantastic mouth feel and kind of just slides down your throat like silk. It's definitely pricier than boba, but really worth a try if you've never had it. I will be back, and my son will probably be able to try something with the fresh fruit he read about.

Chinatown who? Desert Inn and Durango is where it's at!

OMG... I totally love this place! I am happy now that I do not have to go all the way to Chinatown for boba, but sad that they don't have more than one location.

I order mostly from their milk tea menu, but sometimes get the slushies with milk too---it is not on the menu, but you can definitely order it. The fishballs are soooo good. I ordered them not spicy, but they still have somewhat of a tang to them.

The staff is friendly and their service is speedy, but it depends on how many people are there. I have never found this place empty!

You gotta go here!

Note: Don't forget to get a stamp card! 10 stamps and you a get free boba! :)

Love this place! My first ever experience with Boba ( I get the strawberry banana slush w Boba, though I've also tried the Milk Tea, Mango slush, and working my way down the list till I got to that Avacado slush - SURPRISINGLY TASTY btw!!! ) and I loved it! Not to mention the staff is extremely friendly, fast and easy to talk to. Reasonably priced, plenty of parking...highly recommended!

Seriously go here.  It's bomb.
I love this place! Their strawberry and kiwi slushy's are great. My only complaint is that sometimes they end up watery.

Pretty new to the whole boba thing,  This place isn't bad.  A good selection of boba.  I actually really like the blended fruit drinks.  The watermelon is more like drinking fresh watermelon.  Not overly sweet and heavy.  Very refreshing.  Cute place.  I would definitely come back for the fruit drinks.

After I visited Mad Pita for the first time today I decided to also tr out Easy Life Boba Tea while I was in the area. 

I Ordered a Watermelon smoothie, a banana smoothie and a milk tea. All with boba as I love good tapioca. 

The Watermelon smoothie was pretty great. 
The Banana smoothie was amazing.
The Milk tea was slightly above OK. 

The tapioca was very good, not great.  At No 1 boba every time I have been there the tapioca is made fresh all day and has always been warm. This tapioca was still on the fresh side but didn't have the perfect consistency for me.  It was slighly tough.  I also find the fresh fruit smoothies(better fresh fruit to ice ratio) and milk tea at No 1 boba in Chinatown to be a notch above Easy Life. 

Where Easy life dominates is the service. It was friendly, they were cool and that  goes a very long way with me.  The menu and options are  plentiful  which is also a plus. The Tapioca and less than amazing milk tea are the key factors in giving it a solid 4 stars. 

I will be making a return trip to try out some of the teas and other items. I am a fan Easy Life I think  they can pick  their  tapioca and milk tea game with a little time and expertise, at which point I will be happy to update my review.

On a side note, I am so obsessed with the little plastic film lids they seal the tapioca drinks with at all quality boba spots. I see so many amazing uses for the technology. I would seal everything.
Taro boba smoothie is outstanding!

This is my favorite Boba in Vegas! I have tried so many places and not only does this place have THE BEST TASTING boba and drinks, but the prices are awesome and fair. 
I wish there was a place closer to me, but this place is worth the extra 10 min drive. I LOVE YOU EASY LIFE! You showed me the great world of milk tea and boba! 
I am forever a loyal customer here!

Weekend afternoon - Saturday/Sunday - takeout for party of 8

Definitely did not expect to find this in this location.  Visiting Las Vegas for EDC left us with not much time (or desire) to go out exploring food options in the city.  I Yelped the nearest bubble tea spot and whaddya know, it's 5 minutes away with stellar ratings.  Well, long story short, I was not disappointed.

My avocado smoothie was perfect - fresh avocado, not too sweet, and perfectly cooked pearls (chewy and slightly sweeter than the rest of the drink).  I really enjoyed it from beginning to end, without getting sick of it.  I tried a variety of other options as we were ordering takeout for a large group, and every combination was good.  We also tried the strawberry banana smoothie, taro and pudding milk teas, and passion fruit with grass jelly.  All drinks were close to perfect and some ended up as great mixers as well.  

Will definitely try to make it back when I return to Vegas!

I give two stars to this place because the boba is always so mushy and flavorless or it's super undercooked and hard in the middle, the milk teas, especially the Thai tea is so watered down and plus with the ice, it gets worse. By the time I get home, which is 5 mins, my whole milk tea tastes like water. They're a bit overpriced for the quality they serve, in my opinion.

I was pleasantly surprised to find a wide selection of drinks at a good price here.  The strawberry banana was great but the milk tea was just not my cup of tea.  The service is fast and friendly, I got my drink in probably less than two minutes of ordering and the portions are good for the price.  

It's interesting the location of this place considering it's so far from Chinatown and in an area you wouldn't think of people liking boba.  I was even more astounded when about a group of 10 teens all crowded the place as I was leaving.

I would say 5 stars for anyone in Vegas, but it falls short compared to some places in San Francisco, so 4 stars to me.

The only gripe I have is that they close so damn early! 9pm? Please extend your hours to 10 or 11 so I'm not watching the clock after I get off work so I can make it in time. 

My fiancé and I have tried both the almond milk tea and the jasmine milk tea. The almond has an almost artificial taste to it and I'm not saying that it's a bad thing, I'm just saying it's not for me. The jasmine milk tea on the other hand, is a home run and is truly enjoyable especially when paired with the egg pudding in place of Boba (we like our Boba a little firmer and it's  a bit on the soft and chewy side for me to enjoy.)

The staff here are always nice and never make you feel rushed even if you show up 3 minutes before closing like I have (sorry employees I get off work late.) I am interested in sampling more flavors that they offer during our next visit and I'll be sure to update my review accordingly. 

Definitely a good spot to try near Summerlin that doesn't require the trek to Chinatown in order to get your Boba fix.
The best boba tea in Las Vegas.Green tea boba is my favorite.  My husband and I love going there . Great service!
This is one of my favorite boba places, been coming here for years. There drinks and small finger foods are great! Nice having something close by the house!

Always come here when I have a boba craving! The prices are incredibly decent, the store is always clean & they have fun promotional discounts quite frequently. The tea and smoothies are delicious & the boba is always fresh (never "old" or "stale" like some places) I strongly recommend either the milk or thai tea, but in actuality, its ALL good :)

Reliable, quick and good-flavored. I'm a fan of their popcorn chicken because it has a nice spice to it and the meat isn't stringy, but I assume boba places can't mess that up too badly. I'd still like to try more items on their menu, but so far my favorite is their Taro Milk Tea. I usually get it without boba since it doesn't have too much flavor (especially when compared to T-Pumps in the bay area that has honey-infused boba). Teenagers haven't been too rowdy/annoying in here like other boba places and they have plenty of seating space. They keep all the table tops clean, as well as their bathroom in the back. They have a few toy machines and a crane machine if you find yourself with some extra pocket change. Workers have always been pleasant and will ask you if you want upgrades or add-ons, just in case you missed it on the menu.
I genuinely love this place. The coffee slush with boba. The popcorn chicken. Never had a bad visit, they are so friendly and so quick. Plus their rewards program is pretty great!

For a small place this stuff is good! I knew nothing about this place going in except for the fact that the stuff on the pics look good. And it is fact! I had the mango strawberry and its phenomenal! Plus the bathroom is pretty clean

When it comes to Boba...this is our to go to place! I always order my avocado smoothie with a little boba which is made from real avocados...thank God! My husband gets his usual ..coffee slush with coffee jelly. That's good if your a coffee lover. Staff is polite and your order is pretty quick. Again, we will return. HAPPY DRINKING YELPERS!!

What a rip off. I've been coming here longer then the girls who serviced me. They used to have a good boba to milk tea ratio all the way up till today. I have no issue with paying for the boba separately but barely getting any just felt like I got ripped off. I'm no longer going to come back to this place to let them nickel and dime me to death.

Really, I would give them 4.5 stars because they're not perfect, but yelp doesn't give me this option. Really, the only reason I would give them 4.5 stars would be because you have to add 50 cents to the price if you want boba in your drink.

Overall, this place is amazing and right by my house. I love going there and I frequently crave it. They also give out stamp cards where you buy 10 drinks over time and get one free. I have yet to fill one up completely though because I keep loosing the cards. 

My favorites include the watermelon slushie and the strawberry banana smoothie. Get a large as well! The price is only 50 cents more for a large in most cases. Your really cheating yourself out if you don't get the actual tapioca balls in your drink, so I definitely suggest adding the boba to your drink.

Alright one thing that bothers me about this place is why tf is the milk tea boba not ice cold?? How do you screw this up. It tastes like it is sitting in room temperature and even with ice cubes in it, it's not fresh and satisfying. I actually feel like it makes me thirstier LOL?? 

So the taste is alright, price is decent but I haven't even drank half of my drink and I'm already tired of it  I saw that they keep the milk tea in this wannabe ice cooler that probably doesn't even work properly. They pour the milk tea into a cup and put ice cubes in it but honestly it does NOT HELP. Either the milk tea or boba is so warm it just tones everything down. Sad because I love taro milk tea. 

Probably won't come back unless they make some big changes.
One of my fav boba places in Vegas! love it here! the service is always amazing and the drinks are reasonably priced especially for how delicious they are!

I got the milk jasmine boba, it was delicious however their customer service is lacking. Definitely makes the whole transaction not pleasing and awkward. May come here again when I'm in the area but I won't go out of my way to come here again.

Have been coming here throughout the past 3 years of my residency in Las Vegas. The place is in need of renovation, but I have nothing but stellar reviews for this boba spot! My milk tea is always on point whenever I come here and cannot preach about how happy I get when ordering their large drink!

Inside Scoop: try their hazelnut milk tea! Their Tiger Tea (Half Milk Tea/Half Thai Tea) is definitely worth a try as well! In the mood for a light Snack? Order their lobster balls! I like mine extra spicy! 

Final Verdict: Definitely worth the visit if you're around the area! Would without a doubt make more trips to this spot if it was closer to my house.

This boba place make my Jasmine Milk Tea like no other. 

I live 15 minute away from Easy Life Boba Tea, but if I get the craving, then I will do what it takes to get to this heavenly place. 

It's just that.... UBERSUPERWONDERFULLYDELICIOUS! 

So worth my hard earn cash (and gas).... so worth it. PERIOD!



PS. This is one of the rare boba shop that accept debit cards. Woaaah.
I have been a loyal customer and love all their Boba Tea drinks. I highly recommend to anyone looking for a Boba place.

THE BEST BOBA PLACE YOU WILL EVER GO TO! If you wanted to try a new boba drink place, this is the place! I have always ordered Boba Milk Teas here since they have opened (I think 2008, not sure). Plus if you order $20 or more they give you a loyalty card. The drinks are always great and will satisfy your tastebuds. The employees here are always happy to serve customers and are very friendly. Will definitely recommend to my friends and family here.

I used to come here regularly and usually everyone is friendly but last night the people that were working are not as friendly. 


The other girl is nice the one that worked on the register but the other one just giving us weird look and they both didn't welcome us.

I've been here 4 times in the last 8 days.  It's rare for me to visit any restaurant 4 times in an entire year but this place warrants the attention.

I have yet to try any of their drinks but based on the quality of their fluffy snow ice, I am sure they deliver in all of their other choices.  The fluffy snow is like none other.  It's so light, tasty, and packed with fruit deliciousness.

Be sure to try all 3 of the flavors between Thai Tea, Strawberry, and Mango.  I love the kiwi, aloe vera, and their pudding.  Be sure to get a rewards card which is only 50 cents especially if you plan to frequent over and over again like I will.  I believe you get 1 point per dollar spent and then at 50 points, you get $5 off.

This place is 2.5 stars, but feeling generous today, so rounded up! I've tried better since I am comparing this to NYC. The milk tea is really nothing special. I could not call it bad because I had worst but it was nothing to rave about. The only thing that different and unique is probably the size of the plastic cup. The popcorn chicken should be AVOIDED. It seem like the popcorn chicken is used to make a profit from high school student who lack money. So if you were coming to Easy Life Boba Tea, I will recommend a drink and stay away from the food!
Oh my gosh, so good! Went in right before closing and got a Thai milk tea boba (my fav) and it totally hit the spot. Noticed this spot while driving by, so glad we stopped! Yum!!!

Easy Life has been my go-to boba place for a few years now.

I've heard some people say the boba is supposed to be a little mushier, but Easy Life's boba balls are more on the chewy side. I kind of like them like that though. I'm pretty simple, so I always get their boba milk tea. Delicious. Never lets me down. 

Their snacks are also pretty tasty. They have noms from popcorn chicken to squid and lobster balls. They're called "snacks" for a reason, so don't expect a full on meal!

The atmosphere is laid back. I've seen people chilling and hanging out with friends. I've seen others studying there. The boba gals are always really nice and seem happy, even when its a little hectic. They're also fairly quick with their service so you should be in and out in a jiffy when you're in a rush. 

I just wish they didn't have limited hours during the winter months. I guess I understand that business is a little slower but I'm still willing to get boba later at night!  But other than that, I really don't have any complaints about this place.

Currently my most frequented boba place. Really close to my house so I don't have to navigate the drivers on Spring Mt. The boba tastes great (i usually get the jasmine milk tea with boba) and there's a $1off large drink everytime you check in!

Boba spots are no where near me so came across this place after a friend recommended it. It's pretty good and they have a decent vareity of drinks on their menu. I always go for my favorite-- jasmine milk tea boba. The girl working there let me sample it before I purchased and even though it was too sweet for my liking, I was happy when she told me I can adjust the sweetness!

Only giving 4 stars as I cannot say how the other drinks or food are, but I will be coming back!

Since its a hot day today in the 100's. My bf and I decided to stop by and get a drink.i always get my usual pearl milk tea and it's so refreshing! Perfect for this hot weather . Service was great and fast. Not a long wait. Staff is always friendly.
Lovely little Boba tea shop. The bubble tea is my favorite. Cheap and they always have specials going on.

Every time I get great customer service. The employees ask me how my day is, laugh, and actually look like they enjoy working there!  I stop by quite a few times a month and every time I get the same result. The drinks are so tasty and always made to perfection! My number one boba spot that I will continue to frequent with my cravings!

Probably 1 of the better places to get Boba in town. Drinks are ALWAYS way to sweet. So if you don't like sweet, warning. 
DO NOT USE THE TOY machine. Pretty sure they know it's broken and they refuse to do anything about it. They say they will tell the owner. Okay, then put on a sign so people don't put $ in.
Amazing boba place with jumbo size and I really like coming here and enjoying delicious Thai goodness.

My fiancee and I have been coming here since they opened and love it every single time! I've always enjoyed the vanilla milk tea. The boba is always on point and has the perfect consistency, which is why I keep coming back haha. The fiancee enjoys the taro milk tea almost every time haha.

Personally, I have tried other flavors such as the thai iced tea, the almond milk tea, and the caramel frappe among others, but I always find myself coming back to the vanilla. I'm not saying the other flavors are crap, but for some reason I'm all about vanilla haha. 

I'm really happy that there's a good boba place close by to where we live. It really makes it easier bc we don't have to travel into china town haha.

Solid local boba spot. Not the best in the city but it's local so if you're craving some milk tea you don't need to drive all the way to Chinatown. They have plenty of options such as hot, cold, slushes and smoothies. I went with the hot milk tea with some boba. Tasty selection and perfect for a cold day. A little slow if you go with a line but all in all a good go.

I love this hidden little gem of a place. They make one of the best lychee slushes I've had when it comes to a boba tea establishment. The ladies are always so pleasant to see and remember my order whenever I come in. They treat you like a VIP and that service seems to be difficult to find these days. I will always recommend people to come here! Xx

When I'm driving, I am usually very focused on the one task at hand; getting to my destination. However one day, while going through this area of town, I got a hankering for some boba. I made my boyfriend do a Yelp search on my phone, and lo and behold, Easy Life was only 5 minutes away. I clicked for directions, and was directed to a quaint little drink shop across from a large soccer park.

Now, I am a very picky person when it comes to my boba. The consistency has to be perfect. Cooked just right. Under-cooked boba will leave you with a gross, hard center. Over-cooked boba will be too chewy. But Easy Life got that part just right. 

So why only 3 stars, you ask?
