I got the mango fluffy snow ice with mangos (which were tasty and ripe!), strawberries, and lychee jelly.  I had also asked for some pudding but i guess they forgot about that request.  

Anyway, the snow ice was tasty, but i have to say i was a bit disappointed at the texture.  Yes, it's fluffy, but it's also got a bunch of little ice particles that take away from the fluffiness, adding a crunch that I didn't particularly like (and normally I like added crunchiness!).  It's as if they mixed shaved ice and shaved snow.  If you prefer the light, smooth fluffiness of Class 302's shaved snow, you may not enjoy this as much...  If you haven't had Class 302, then this will probably be "different" enough to win over a number of fans as a new frozen dessert experience.  Alas, having had better, this was just a step backwards for me....
Always loving the fish and lobster balls and you cannot leave the place without boba. Amazing

Gah! So bummed. I checked in AFTER I paid. So no $1 off for me this time. But I'll make a mental note for next time since we're always next door for amazing Indian food. 

I ordered an almond smoothie with boba. So refreshing. and no caffeine (I think) which is good since I'm expecting. But their boba is OK. Not sure why I'm not a total fan. Its soft and chewy. I think its bc its lacking flavor?

What I'm impressed about is that they serve popcorn chicken and fried fish balls! I didn't try them but I will if I ever need a snack. Also, they make ice milk here! Which is all the rage in so cal right now. More reasons to come back and try these different things!

I love easy life boba! It was my first time trying fluffy snow, and it was extremely light and delicious. I got the thai tea fluffy snow topped with condensed milk, mochi, and strawberries. Next time, I think I'll try another flavor and mix it up a bit. They have mango, thai tea, and strawberry fluffy snow with a very large selection of topping choices. Their boba drinks are always perfect. I usually get the egg pudding milk tea because it's my favorite! The boba is nice and soft, but not too soggy or ruined by a hard center like other places. Perfect scoop boba and easy life boba definitely outshines the chinatown spots including tea station. There's no need for me to drive so far to satisfy my cravings anymore. :)
Talk about fresh! Got the watermelon/strawberry slush with boba, probably never getting anything else. Definitely coming back.

Solid all around. I've been coming here for over 10 years and they are always very good. I haven't been here in a while, since I now live out of town, but they now have snow ice. 

Their boba is always perfect and they have lots of options.

I like to order from the top seller list (they have a big sign right where you order). Their service is always quick and friendly. I love coming here and recommend it to everyone!

Who knew that there were so many different kinds of ice to be had in this town?  Shave ice, snow ice, and now, Fluffy snow.  I was intrigued by the coupon I got in a mailer that touted the stuff at Easy Life, so I ventured over there last night after dinner at Settebello.
There are three flavors available:  Thai tea, mango, and strawberry.  I ordered the small size with red beans, bananas, and condensed milk and it was plenty; I'm not sure I could handle a bigger size.  The best way to describe the ice is that it's a cross between gelato and sherbet.  I think I was expecting something more like the snow ice at Icy Juicy, which I absolutely love and to which I am addicted.  This was definitely heavier in consistency and tasted good, but I think I still like snow ice better, maybe because you can start with just plain snow ice and then add the flavors you want to it.  I wouldn't normally order strawberry, Thai tea, or mango gelato or sherbet, so there you go!

This place used to be my main boba spot just Becuase I live less then 1 minute away. They have really good fluffy ice here with Mochi. I still have this place in a spot in my heart. If I am in a hurry this is my spot to get my boba. Everything is very delicious but I prefer getting their chocolate milk tea. It's an A+ in my book.

Went here on 6/5/14 with Ardie Y. & Sho Y. after lunch to grab a drink. I'd say that I've had a fair amount of boba both in and out of Vegas and I definitely have my favorites. Easy Life is not my favorite.

What is with the fact that you have to pay for a loyalty punch card, and you only get a punch if you spend something crazy like, every $20 (if I remember correctly.) Maybe if you were buying drinks for a family of 4 every time you popped in that would make sense, but no. Yeah, so no punch card for me.

I got my go to drink, jasmine milk tea but with lychee jelly and no boba this time. My drink tasted like water. No jasmine tea flavor. Lychee jelly had no strong flavor either.
Disappointing.

On a positive note, the place is clean and POPPING. Like, they get super, crazy, busy. Seating is ample so again, that's a plus.

I'm going to stick to my Volcano Tea & QQ Boba.

We have been coming here for many many years (10+ years). It's the BEST boba in Vegas for sure & we pretty much always order the same items. 

What's disappointing on my last 2 visits was the pop corn chicken. It used to be prepared with a fried basil which was crunchy & gave the dish something special. However,they no longer have the basil & serve it plain which makes it just blahhh..to the Management here..don't fix what's not broke. You ruined a perfect little dish :(

We always sample boba before ordering to ensure the boba is not soggy. Found this place on living social. Ordered 3 different drinks and they all taste great. Good prices. Boba is fresh. This is definitely one of the better boba shop located on the west side of the city.

I like how close Easy Life is really close to my house and not located in Chinatown but I don't go here that often. I feel like this place isn't authentic..However my boyfriend and cousins go gaga for Easy Life.

There wasn't much of  selection for fresh fruit so I ended up ordering an avocado drink with coconut jelly. The drink had a really strong condense milk flavor to it but I eally liked the coconut jelly. I also tried lobster balls and the lychee green tea and those were just okay.

Great place for boba! Yummy choices and my favorite place to go for boba :) I like the Thai tea , pearl milk , taro smoothie, coconut smoothie, well it's your choice their all good :) they have different sizes too! Take your pick !

Still one of my go-to spots for boba... Whenever I'm in the mood for my favorite coffee milk tea of theirs, I will usually make a stop before heading home.  It's nice and convenient since the location is prime, just being down the street and a quick drive from where I live.  During summers I frequent there a lot, in-and-out each visit with my to-go drink (and the occasional snack) in hand.

HOWEVER... I have dropped my rating for them by one star from my previous review.  Why?  For one reason only: Because of their new "large" size cold drink cup.....which is more like a bowl, instead of a cup.  If you have small hands, it's not the ideal size, unless you intend on holding your drink with two hands.  Good thing for me, I usually take my drink home, with no intention of carrying it around with me while I shop, or what not.  But even so, this new large-sized to-go cup/bowl does NOT even fit in your standard car CUP-HOLDER!  So WTH is the point in that??!!?

It works fine if you don't have a front-seat passenger, because the cup/bowl is seriously BIG ENOUGH to be placed on the passenger seat with the seat belt on!

I had a hot taro bubble tea; I asked for it to be made roughly half as sweet as normal, and they seemed to have complied--the sweetness level was not overwhelming. The tea itself had a reasonable amount of boba; it's a little expensive for the size, tbh, but still enjoyable. They do have wi-fi too, which is a plus.
The best boba I've had in town. I have yet to try the fluffy ice, but the tea & slush are deelish. The boba is always so fresh and they use top quality ingredients. They set the bar high for boba!

Love my avocado smoothie with boba & lychee here! I have tried so many places and this is hands down the best! I wish they would get some crystal boba and it would make their boba place even more amazing!

This is the second time I've been here in a week so that should tell you something. Their fluffy snow is absolutely delightful I am lactose intolerant and this stuff is so close to the texture and sweetness if icecream it really satisfies that craving. I'm trying the strawberry one today I tried the mango one last time. Good stuff addicting must try you'll be hooked!

Their boba can be a bit of a choking hazard I think....a bunch were stuck together into two-fers so it took a lot of suck to get some of those babies up the straw. I was worried one of those things was going to fly right down the windpipe. I also got coffee jelly which also seemed to negatively impact the hydrodynamics of the whole thing. 

My Thai Tea was otherwise delicious and the boba itself was actually some of the better I've had. I have yet to try their fluffy snow and was going to ask for a sample but it got busy and I never got a chance. 

Prices are about on par with other boba joints (i.e. kinda expensive).

I came here after having excellent fresh taro boba in California- that's what started my obsession! Anyway, they were friendly, fast and the place was clean but my taro was lacking, I wonder if they use powder? 
I've only ever known fresh taro. 

Now I'm on a hunt for the best freshest taro boba in Vegas! Unfortunately this place isn't it. 
If I go back, I would only get their most popular item- the avocado.
Many choices!!  The inside sitting area doesn't seem the cleanest however the boba tea is extremely good!
I've only had their milk teas in the past and they always tasted like the powder variety. The boba balls are just all right.

Cute little shop.  Easy to find location in a strip mall.  Nice selection of snow ice, Boba teas, slushes and a few snack items. We tried the taro/red bean with Boba and the strawberry milk tea.  Both were delicious.  Prices seemed high compared to other local tea/smoothie locations.  Plenty of helpful, friendly staff.  I think we will be back!
My favorite place to get boba! I normally get green or jasmine milk tea. The flavor never changes. The consistency of the boba is perfect!
Taro milk Tea is amazing! All the flavor without being overly sweet.  My kiddos got the Thai milk tea with boba and are silent! This will be our new place. Yummmy!

I'm usually in & out! I Love my Boba! only place in Summerlin I trust with my boba. Always very clean when I go in, they have the VIP reward cards which I am all about. People are always really nice so that's good. no complaints what so ever.

& they have the extra size of boba which makes everything that much better!

When I go, I usually make a boba run for work so I'm ordering like 5 drinks at once & I never have a complain at work. Although they do not have my favorite "berry" drink, I'm pleased with Taro.

Suggestion box? Raspberry, Blueberry, & Strawberry smoothie!

I lived out in central PA for 4 years, and seriously, there was NO GOOD BOBA to be found anywhere....so my tolerance for mediocre boba may have increased in that time frame.

That being said, Easy Life boba is pretty good. It's not the best Boba I've ever had, I mean, coming from CA originally, there are tons of better boba tea options out there. The tea here is pretty good - a little sweeter than I'd like, but the boba is always chewy and bouncy :), and since it's practically on my way home from work, it's a convenient spot. The shop itself is pretty bare, but they have a large selection of teas/slushies/juices/coffee. It's a bit pricy ($4 at least for a large boba), but I'm willing to pay to get my boba fix!

I can already forsee this being a weekly stop for me!

Their black tea passion fruit with boba was delicious! I tried my friend's mango black tea with boba and that was really good too! Their flavors are awesome and plus the worker made our drinks lightning fast. I had barely finished paying when she had already finished mine. Cute place to hang out too, they even have snacks! Will be coming here again for sure.

We were in Vegas for a concert and on our last day we had a craving for some boba for the drive back home to California. So I Yelped and saw that Easy Life Boba Tea offered a blended Thai Tea slush which is our favorite. A little bit of a drive from our hotel we decided to give it a try. 

We ordered two Blended Thai Teas with boba. Prices were similar to L.A. prices so that was good. The Thai Tea was ok. Not what we're used too at one of the places we go to in Los Angeles area. The boba to me is not the consistency that I like, so I wasn't impressed with it. Never the less, it made the drive home good having something to drink.

Really good boba here. Found this location from the Yelp app. The prices are kinda high for a large milk tea but tastes better than other milk tea's I've tasted before. Also you can sign up with their texting service to receive coupons on your next purchase here.  This is the only boba place I know that does that. It's a nice location and you can walk across the street to the nearby park and relax.

I'm not sure what most people are expecting out of a boba place, but Easy Life was as good as any other I've had. The girls are friendly, the flavor was spot on, and the boba count was just right.
I can't say that any boba joint has "blown me away", however several have let me down.
Easy Life has not let me down.

This boba place has always been very close to my past few safe houses.  In fact if you were to plot the past safe house locations on the map, Easy Life Boba Tea will pretty much be in the middle.  Just an observation.

Anyway, there has been some recent activities on the fluffy snow ice scene in Las Vegas, with one opened by a celebrity chef and another by individuals completely off the radar.  If you are an active duty Yelp operative, you will likely know their names, employment history, and what they did last summer.

My visit to ELBT is to check out how the fluffy snow ice measures up to the new competitions.  So here is my report based on my observations and my order of a Large Mango Snow with Green Apple Jelly, Strawberry and Mango with Condensed Milk:

Sizes (3):
Small ($5.25 includes 1 regular and 1 premium toppings)
Medium (No show. Must be out of this most average & popular of container sizes)
Large ($7.25 includes 1 regular and 2 premium toppings)
Jumbo ($9.25 includes 2 regular and 2 premium toppings)

The Small is perfect for a snack for one. Large is big enough for me, but it is pretty much a meal replacement.  Jumbo is suitable for competitive eaters, but best shared with a few friends that does not mind cooties.  If they do, they can get their own Small or have a friend administers a cootie shot.  

Flavors comes in three varieties (Strawberry, Mango and Thai Tea), so if just competing on that simplistic variable alone, ELBT comes in with the least amount of "snow" selections. 

Toppings:  8 regular (Boba, Mochi, Pudding, Red Bean, Lichi Jelly, Coconut Jelly and Green Apple Jelly) and 6 premium (Mango, Strawberry, Kiwi, Banana, Aloe Vera and Coffee Jelly).  

Flavoring (aka Sauce): 4 to drizzle with (Condensed Milk, Chocolate Syrup, Brown Sugar Syrup, Caramel Syrup).

Again, overall number of selection to top off and customize your "snow" order with is not bad, but falls short of the competition.  But ELBT have the majority of the stuff I would want to order normally, so I don't care if they don't have gummy bears, Cap't Crunch, M&M's, etc. on their list.

Texture & Flavor:  Texture of the fluffy snow here is decent. However, you can still easily detect the slightly gritty ice crystals in your mouth, but it is a vast improvement over the offering at Kuma, but still not as perfect as Frost Bites Shavery (recently re-branded SnowFlake Shavery and relocated to their new brick and mortar location on Spring Mountain/Decatur in late Aug. 2013).  Flavor of the snow is good (but not made from all natural ingredients), not too strong or mild, but just enough.

Service:  High schoolers behind the counter, so your service mileage will vary greatly depending on the usual variables (cuteness, personality, your kicks,etc.)

So when it is hot and you want something to cool you down, and flavored snow dessert is what you crave, apply sun block (SPF40+) according to instruction and drive/bike/bus/teleport yourself to ELBT for a cool one.

Greater than A-OK.


---- End of Transmission ---

Walked in with my brother one day. Ordered a smoothie and almond milk tea, both with boba. Prices were good. Service was good. Place was clean. Tea itself was good. The only thing was my boba was chewier and harder than I'd like. When I'm out looking for boba on the very rare occasion, I hope for it to be perfectly soft. Sorry. Its not a bad place at all. Thats just my preference.

I use to come here all the time then I moved a little further away and have not come in for a little while so we decided to stop by today to get a boba drink. My daughter and I always ask to have a large drink split in two because she is only 8 and can't finish one by her self. They use to split the drinks for us and just charge an extra dollar for the cup and boba but they refused to do it this time so we left and will never go back.

Not as great as tea station, but it will do for a quick milk tea crave. I got the jasmine milk tea the first time I came here, felt like I downed a whole bag of sugar, it was overly sweet. Second time I was here, I asked them to take down the sweet to a lower level, added red bean, it was better. Typically I would come back if I was in the area, but not my number one choice.
Had coffee slush with coffee jelly. Nice flavor and very refreshing. Coffee jelly is fun to drink!

They over charged me for a drink by one dollar I know it's only one dollar but still. It's annoying. I asked for a tea drink and they gave me a slush instead which is one dollar more but I also didn't want a cup of ice either. The slushed are ice. I tried to tell them but I was in a hurry to go somewhere else and I didn't want to wait. I asked for a tea drink but to blend the ice in the tea drink so it's not ice cubes. There tea drinks have a little ice in them. There slushes have mostly ice and that's the difference. Low stars only cause they didn't lesson to what I asked them and then they charged me a extra dollar for something I didn't order.
